title: Australian state proposes two-year prison sentence for possession of Extinction Rebellion 'human lock'
text:
The government of the Australian state of Queensland has proposed severe penalties for Extinction Rebellion protesters, including two-year prison sentences for anyone caught with a locking device used to fix people in public places.

The environmentalists have held demonstrations throughout Australia this week, blocking traffic in central business districts, locking on to heavy items like water tanks in intersections, and supergluing themselves to windows and the road in a bid to pressure governments on climate change.

Under the legislation proposed by the Labor government in Queensland, simply possessing a locking device used to secure people in positions obstructing thoroughfares such as those knows as ‘dragon’s dens’, ‘sleeping dragons’, ‘mono-poles’ or ‘tripods’, could attract up to two years in prison or fines of up to £3,310 pounds.

Queensland Premier Anna Palaszczuk said the state was experiencing “major disruption” as a result of the civil disobedience tactics of climate activists.
